title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We also saw Dundas Castle, belonging to Dundas of Dundas, and further on, beyond Hopetoun,  Blackness Castle, famous in history.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: We also saw Dundas Castle, belonging toDundas of Dundas, and further on, beyond Hopetoun, Blackness Castle, famous in history.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Further on, upon the same side, and about a mile from the shore, is Hopetoun House, the splendid mansion of the Earl of Hopetoun ; and on a peninsula to the westward, stands Blackness Castle, one of the four fortresses which, by the Articles of the Union, are to be kept constantly  garrisoned.

title: The heart of Midlothian;
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: A heavy fine might be imposed ; an order for committing him to Edinburgh or Blackness Castle seems not improper ; even a charge of treason might be laid on many of these words and expressions, though God forbid I should prosecute the matter to that extent.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: It started at DnnglasCastle on the Clyde to the Hills above Caer Ridden Kirk, beyond the river Avonon the Firth of Forth or perhaps two miles farther to Blackness Castle,although there is no trace of it now.
